snippet: Trinniberg, a 50-1 long shot in Saturday’s Kentucky Derby, is a sprinter who will start at top speed and not look back, his handlers say.
abstract: Contenders at the Kentucky Derby will have to reckon with Trinniberg, 50-1 long shot who is likely to burst from the gate and set a blistering pace; Trinniberg has never run longer than seven furlongs; chart shows Derby field. Chart (M)/
lead_paragraph: LOUISVILLE, Ky. -- No one begrudged Shivananda Parbhoo his ear-to-ear smile on Friday morning. It was the day before the Kentucky Derby, and he had a horse named Trinniberg with a date in the starting gate. He had picked the colt out himself at a sale in Florida for a bargain price of $21,000. But there are a couple of horsemen here who would have preferred that Parbhoo had skipped the race. Even though Trinniberg is 50-1 on the morning line, he may have a powerful say on how the race will be run and who will be its winner.

headline.main: Contenders Will Have to Adjust to a Long Shot's All-Out Style
